title: Amazon Linux 2 2017.12 - ALAS2-2021-1644: important priority package update for thunderbird
description:
Package updates are available for Amazon Linux 2 that fix the following vulnerabilities:
CVE-2021-29948:
	No description is available for this CVE.
1951381: CVE-2021-29948 Mozilla: Race condition when reading from disk while verifying signatures

CVE-2021-29946:
	No description is available for this CVE.
1951371: CVE-2021-29946 Mozilla: Port blocking could be bypassed

CVE-2021-29945:
	No description is available for this CVE.
1951370: CVE-2021-29945 Mozilla: Incorrect size computation in WebAssembly JIT could lead to null-reads

CVE-2021-24002:
	No description is available for this CVE.
1951369: CVE-2021-24002 Mozilla: Arbitrary FTP command execution on FTP servers using an encoded URL

CVE-2021-23999:
	No description is available for this CVE.
1951368: CVE-2021-23999 Mozilla: Blob URLs may have been granted additional privileges

CVE-2021-23998:
	No description is available for this CVE.
1951366: CVE-2021-23998 Mozilla: Secure Lock icon could have been spoofed

CVE-2021-23995:
	No description is available for this CVE.
1951365: CVE-2021-23995 Mozilla: Use-after-free in Responsive Design Mode

CVE-2021-23994:
	No description is available for this CVE.
1951364: CVE-2021-23994 Mozilla: Out of bound write due to lazy initialization

CVE-2021-23993:
	No description is available for this CVE.
1948395: CVE-2021-23993 Mozilla: Inability to send encrypted OpenPGP email after importing a crafted OpenPGP key

CVE-2021-23992:
	No description is available for this CVE.
1948394: CVE-2021-23992 Mozilla: A crafted OpenPGP key with an invalid user ID could be used to confuse the user

CVE-2021-23991:
	No description is available for this CVE.
1948393: CVE-2021-23991 Mozilla: An attacker may use Thunderbird's OpenPGP key refresh mechanism to poison an existing key

CVE-2021-23961:
	Further techniques that built on the slipstream research combined with a malicious webpage could have exposed both an internal network's hosts as well as services running on the user's local machine. This vulnerability affects Firefox < 85.
1951367: CVE-2021-23961 Mozilla: More internal network hosts could have been probed by a malicious webpage
